NavigatorUAData.summary: NOTE Experimental The NavigatorUAData interface of the {{domxref("User-Agent Client Hints API", "", "", "nocode")}} returns information about the browser and operating system of a user.

remarks.para: An instance of this object is returned by calling or . Therefore, this interface has no constructor.

blockquote.para: The terms high entropy and low entropy refer to the amount of information these values reveal about the browser. The values returned as properties are deemed low entropy, and unlikely to identify a user. The values returned by could potentially reveal more information. These values are therefore retrieved via a {{jsxref("Promise")}}, allowing time for the browser to request user permission, or make other checks.

remarks.para: -Improving user privacy and developer experience with User-Agent Client Hints

NavigatorUAData.returns: In the following value a number of hints are requested using the method. When the promise resolves, this information is printed to the console.

NavigatorUADataMobile.summary: NOTE Experimental The mobile read-only property of the interface returns a value indicating whether the device is a mobile device.

remarks.para: -The Sec-CH-UA-Mobile header (a low-entropy client hint) contains the same information.

NavigatorUADataMobile.value: A , true if this is a mobile device.

NavigatorUADataGetHighEntropyValues.summary: NOTE Experimental The getHighEntropyValues() method of the interface is a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a dictionary object containing the high entropy values the user-agent returns.

blockquote.para:
The terms high entropy and low entropy refer to the amount of information these values reveal about the browser.
The values returned as properties are deemed low entropy, and unlikely to identify a user.
The values returned by getHighEntropyValues() could potentially reveal more information.
These values are therefore retrieved via a , allowing time for the browser to request user permission, or make other checks.

remarks.para:
-These values are also available as via HTTP request headers:-Low-entropy client hints are sent automatically:-Sec-CH-UA
-Sec-CH-UA-Mobile
-Sec-CH-UA-Platform
-Servers can request to receive high-entropy client hints on subsequent requests, using the Accept-CH header:-Sec-CH-UA-Arch
-Sec-CH-UA-Bitness
-Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version
-Sec-CH-UA-Model
-Sec-CH-UA-Platform-Version

NavigatorUADataGetHighEntropyValues.returns: A that resolves to an object containing some or all of the following values (based on the hints requested):

NavigatorUADataBrands.summary: NOTE Experimental The brands read-only property of the interface returns an array of brand information.

remarks.para: -Sec-CH-UA (a low-entropy client hint) contains the same information.

NavigatorUADataBrands.value: An array containing the following information for each brand:

NavigatorUADataPlatform.summary: NOTE Experimental The platform read-only property of the interface returns the platform brand information.

remarks.para: -The Sec-CH-UA-Platform header (a low-entropy client hint) contains the same information.

NavigatorUADataPlatform.value:
A string containing the platform brand.
For example, "Windows".

NavigatorUADataToJSON.summary: NOTE Experimental The toJSON() method of the interface is a serializer that returns a JSON representation of the low entropy properties of the NavigatorUAData object.

blockquote.para: The terms high entropy and low entropy refer to the amount of information these values reveal about the browser. The low entropy values returned by this method are those which do not reveal information able to identify a user. High entropy values can only be returned by the method.
